definition: surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: She had the good fortune to BE in excellent health all her life.
sentences.chinese: 她一輩子身體都很好，真有福氣。

sentences.english: As we worship Him with these songs, we shall be greatly blessed!
sentences.chinese: 當我們唱詩投入敬拜時，神的福氣亦會隨着降臨。

sentences.english: I congratulate you on your good fortune-does that make me heartless?
sentences.chinese: 好福氣，我給你道喜，你還怪我沒有良心？

sentences.english: I had gas and air, pethidine and then the epidural, which was bliss.
sentences.chinese: 那麼我可以無痛分娩了，這真是有福氣的事。

sentences.english: And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant
sentences.chinese: 耶和華阿，惟有你是神，你也應許將這福氣賜給僕人。

sentences.english: Margie was truly a blessed little girl.
sentences.chinese: 瑪吉真是一個有福氣的小女孩。

sentences.english: And now, O LORD, you are God, and you have promised this good thing to your servant.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華啊，惟有你是神，你也應許將這福氣賜給僕人。

sentences.english: To be filial is in fact the most rewarding thing in life.
sentences.chinese: 對父母盡孝，是人生最大的福氣。

sentences.english: The blessed live on in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 有福氣的人們死後繼續活在天堂。

sentences.english: The floor is not swept in case good fortune is swept out the door too.
sentences.chinese: 過年期間也不掃地，以免把福氣掃出了門。

sentences.english: The chess professor confessed his professioning advishage in the confession.
sentences.chinese: 象棋教授在供狀中供認了其職業福氣。

sentences.english: Hoist "ferro" meaning, have a collection of blessing.
sentences.chinese: 葫蘆有“福祿”之意，有收集福氣的作用。

sentences.english: Large families were once seen as a blessing .
sentences.chinese: 大家庭曾經被看做是一種福氣。

sentences.english: He had lots of children and grandchildren, which for Chinese people is the best luck possible.
sentences.chinese: 他兒孫滿堂，這在中國人看來是最大的福氣。

sentences.english: He has chosen his partner, indeed, with rare felicity.
sentences.chinese: 他在選擇對象的問題上真是太有福氣了。

sentences.english: She is fortunate enough to enjoy good health.
